verb.definition: (of something perceived as hostile, threatening, or negative) become less intense or widespread.
verb.example: the storm suddenly abated

meaning: to give up a position; right; or power

verb.definition: (of a monarch) renounce one's throne.
verb.example: in 1918 Kaiser Wilhelm abdicated as German emperor

verb.definition: Fail to fulfill or undertake (a responsibility or duty)
verb.example: the government was accused of abdicating its responsibility

adjective.definition: Departing from an accepted standard.

noun.definition: A state of temporary disuse or suspension.
noun.example: matters were held in abeyance pending further inquiries

adjective.definition: (of something bad) experienced or present to the maximum degree.
adjective.example: his letter plunged her into abject misery

adjective.definition: (of a person or their behavior) completely without pride or dignity; self-abasing.
adjective.example: an abject apology

verb.definition: Solemnly renounce (a belief, cause, or claim)
verb.example: his refusal to abjure the Catholic faith

meaning: the act of cutting; the natural separation of a leaf or other part of a plant

noun.definition: The natural detachment of parts of a plant, typically dead leaves and ripe fruit.
noun.example: leaf abscission in trees

verb.definition: Leave hurriedly and secretly, typically to avoid detection of or arrest for an unlawful action such as theft.
verb.example: she absconded with the remaining thousand dollars

adjective.definition: Not self-indulgent, especially when eating and drinking.
adjective.example: “We only had a bottle.” “Very abstemious of you.”

meaning: the giving up of certain pleasures

noun.definition: The fact or practice of restraining oneself from indulging in something, typically alcohol.
noun.example: I started drinking again after six years of abstinence

adjective.definition: Extremely bad; appalling.
adjective.example: the quality of her work is abysmal

adjective.definition: Very deep.

meaning: growth in size or increase in amount

noun.definition: The process of growth or increase, typically by the gradual accumulation of additional layers or matter.
noun.example: the accretion of sediments in coastal mangroves

verb.definition: (of sums of money or benefits) be received by someone in regular or increasing amounts over time.
verb.example: financial benefits will accrue from restructuring

adjective.definition: Refusing to be persuaded or to change one's mind.
adjective.example: he is adamant that he is not going to resign

noun.definition: A legendary rock or mineral to which many, often contradictory, properties were attributed, formerly associated with diamond or lodestone.
A thing added to something else as a supplementary rather than an essential part.
noun.example: computer technology is an adjunct to learning

noun.definition: A word or phrase used to amplify or modify the meaning of another word or words in a sentence.

adjective.definition: Connected or added to something, typically in an auxiliary way.
adjective.example: other alternative or adjunct therapies include immunotherapy

verb.definition: Warn or reprimand someone firmly.
verb.example: she admonished me for appearing at breakfast unshaven
synonyms: give a piece of one's mind to

verb.definition: Render (something) poorer in quality by adding another substance, typically an inferior one.
verb.example: the meat was ground fine and adulterated with potato flour

meaning: relating to beauty or the arts

adjective.definition: Concerned with beauty or the appreciation of beauty.
adjective.example: the pictures give great aesthetic pleasure

noun.definition: A set of principles underlying and guiding the work of a particular artist or artistic movement.
noun.example: the Cubist aesthetic

adjective.definition: Influenced or touched by an external factor.
adjective.example: apply moist heat to the affected area

adjective.definition: Artificial, pretentious, and designed to impress.
adjective.example: the gesture appeared both affected and stagy

adjective.definition: Disposed or inclined in a specified way.
adjective.example: you might become differently affected toward him

noun.definition: A spontaneous or natural liking or sympathy for someone or something.
noun.example: he has an affinity for the music of Berlioz

verb.definition: Increase the power, status, or wealth of.
verb.example: an action intended to aggrandize the Frankish dynasty

noun.definition: A whole formed by combining several (typically disparate) elements.
noun.example: the council was an aggregate of three regional assemblies

noun.definition: A material or structure formed from a loosely compacted mass of fragments or particles.

adjective.definition: Formed or calculated by the combination of many separate units or items; total.
adjective.example: the aggregate amount of grants made

verb.definition: Form or group into a class or cluster.
verb.example: the butterflies aggregate in dense groups

noun.definition: Brisk and cheerful readiness.
noun.example: she accepted the invitation with alacrity

meaning: medieval chemical philosophy based on changing metal into gold; a seemingly magical power or process of transmutation

noun.definition: The medieval forerunner of chemistry, based on the supposed transformation of matter. It was concerned particularly with attempts to convert base metals into gold or to find a universal elixir.

verb.definition: Diminish or put at rest (fear, suspicion, or worry)
verb.example: the report attempted to educate the public and allay fears

verb.definition: Make (suffering, deficiency, or a problem) less severe.
verb.example: he couldn't prevent her pain, only alleviate it

meaning: a combination; a mixture of two or more metals

noun.definition: A metal made by combining two or more metallic elements, especially to give greater strength or resistance to corrosion.
noun.example: an alloy of nickel, bronze, and zinc

verb.definition: Mix (metals) to make an alloy.
verb.example: alloying tin with copper to make bronze

meaning: the power to entice by charm

noun.definition: The quality of being powerfully and mysteriously attractive or fascinating.
noun.example: people for whom gold holds no allure

verb.definition: Powerfully attract or charm; tempt.

meaning: to combine into a unified whole

verb.definition: Combine or unite to form one organization or structure.
verb.example: he amalgamated his company with another

adjective.definition: (of language) open to more than one interpretation; having a double meaning.
adjective.example: ambiguous phrases

meaning: the state of having conflicting emotional attitudes

noun.definition: The state of having mixed feelings or contradictory ideas about something or someone.
noun.example: the law's ambivalence about the importance of a victim's identity

meaning: something delicious; the food of the gods

noun.definition: The food of the gods.

verb.definition: Make (something bad or unsatisfactory) better.
verb.example: the reform did much to ameliorate living standards

adjective.definition: (of a person) open and responsive to suggestion; easily persuaded or controlled.
adjective.example: parents who have had easy babies and amenable children

noun.definition: A desirable or useful feature or facility of a building or place.
noun.example: heating is regarded as a basic amenity

meaning: ornament worn as a charm against evil spirits

noun.definition: An ornament or small piece of jewelry thought to give protection against evil, danger, or disease.

meaning: something out of the proper time

noun.definition: A thing belonging or appropriate to a period other than that in which it exists, especially a thing that is conspicuously old-fashioned.
noun.example: everything was as it would have appeared in centuries past apart from one anachronism, a bright yellow construction crane

meaning: medication that reduces or eliminates pain

adjective.definition: (of a drug) acting to relieve pain.

noun.definition: An analgesic drug.

adjective.definition: Comparable in certain respects, typically in a way which makes clearer the nature of the things compared.
adjective.example: they saw the relationship between a ruler and his subjects as analogous to that of father and children

meaning: absence of government; state of disorder

noun.definition: A state of disorder due to absence or nonrecognition of authority.
noun.example: he must ensure public order in a country threatened with anarchy

meaning: something that calms or soothes pain

adjective.definition: Not likely to provoke dissent or offense; inoffensive, often deliberately so.
adjective.example: anodyne New Age music

noun.definition: A painkilling drug or medicine.

adjective.definition: Deviating from what is standard, normal, or expected.
adjective.example: an anomalous situation

noun.definition: A thing or event that existed before or logically precedes another.
noun.example: some antecedents to the African novel might exist in Africa's oral traditions

adjective.definition: Preceding in time or order; previous or preexisting.
adjective.example: the antecedent events that prompt you to break a diet

adjective.definition: Of or belonging to the time before the biblical Flood.
adjective.example: gigantic bones of antediluvian animals

noun.definition: A deep-seated feeling of dislike; aversion.
noun.example: his fundamental antipathy to capitalism

noun.definition: Lack of interest, enthusiasm, or concern.
noun.example: widespread apathy among students

noun.definition: The top or highest part of something, especially one forming a point.
noun.example: the living room extends right up into the apex of the roof

verb.definition: Reach a high point or climax.
verb.example: melodic lines build up to the chorus and it apexes at the solo

noun.definition: A system of reduced fares for scheduled airline flights and railroad journeys that must be booked and paid for before a certain period in advance of departure.
noun.example: Apex fares

meaning: the point in an orbit most distant from the body being orbited; the highest point

noun.definition: The highest point in the development of something; a climax or culmination.
noun.example: the White House is considered the apogee of American achievement

noun.definition: The point in the orbit of the moon or a satellite at which it is furthest from the earth.
A concise saying or maxim; an aphorism.
noun.example: the apothegm “tomorrow is another day”

verb.definition: Pacify or placate (someone) by acceding to their demands.
verb.example: amendments have been added to appease local pressure groups

verb.definition: Relieve or satisfy (a demand or a feeling)
verb.example: we give to charity because it appeases our guilt

noun.definition: A name or title.
noun.example: the city fully justifies its appellation “the Pearl of the Orient.”

noun.definition: An appellation contrôlée.
noun.example: about 20 percent of French wines with an appellation come from Alsace

adjective.definition: Apt in the circumstances or in relation to something.
adjective.example: an apposite quotation

verb.definition: Inform or tell (someone)
verb.example: I thought it right to apprise Chris of what had happened

noun.definition: Approval or praise.
noun.example: the opera met with high approbation

meaning: to take possession of for one's own use; confiscate

adjective.definition: Suitable or proper in the circumstances.
adjective.example: a measure appropriate to a wartime economy

verb.definition: Take (something) for one's own use, typically without the owner's permission.
verb.example: his images have been appropriated by advertisers

verb.definition: Devote (money or assets) to a special purpose.
verb.example: there can be problems in appropriating funds for legal expenses

preposition.example: she remarked apropos of the initiative, “It's not going to stop the abuse.”

adjective.definition: Very appropriate to a particular situation.
adjective.example: the composer's reference to child's play is apropos

meaning: ornate design featuring intertwined curves; a ballet position in which one leg is extended in back while the other supports the weight of the body

noun.definition: A posture in which the body is supported on one leg, with the other leg extended horizontally backward.
An ornamental design consisting of intertwined flowing lines, originally found in Arabic or Moorish decoration.
noun.example: arabesque scrolls

noun.definition: A passage or composition with fanciful ornamentation of the melody.

meaning: the study of material evidence of past human life

noun.definition: The study of human history and prehistory through the excavation of sites and the analysis of artifacts and other physical remains.
Enthusiasm or passion.
noun.example: they felt the stirrings of revolutionary ardor

adjective.definition: Involving or requiring strenuous effort; difficult and tiring.
adjective.example: an arduous journey

meaning: a specialized vocabulary used by a group

noun.definition: The jargon or slang of a particular group or class.
noun.example: teenage argot

verb.definition: Seize (someone) by legal authority and take into custody.
verb.example: the police arrested him for possession of marijuana

verb.definition: Stop or check (progress or a process)
verb.example: the spread of the disease can be arrested

verb.definition: Attract the attention of (someone)
verb.example: his attention was arrested by a strange sound

noun.definition: The action of seizing someone to take into custody.
noun.example: I have a warrant for your arrest

noun.definition: A stoppage or sudden cessation of motion.
noun.example: a respiratory arrest

noun.definition: An object made by a human being, typically an item of cultural or historical interest.
noun.example: gold and silver artifacts

noun.definition: Something observed in a scientific investigation or experiment that is not naturally present but occurs as a result of the preparative or investigative procedure.
noun.example: widespread tissue infection may be a technical artifact

adjective.definition: Without guile or deception.
adjective.example: an artless, naive girl

adjective.definition: Characterized by or suggesting the practice of severe self-discipline and abstention from all forms of indulgence, typically for religious reasons.
adjective.example: an ascetic life of prayer, fasting, and manual labor

noun.definition: A person who practices severe self-discipline and abstention.
Harshness of tone or manner.
noun.example: he pointed this out with some asperity

noun.definition: An attack on the reputation or integrity of someone or something.
noun.example: I don't think anyone is casting aspersions on you

adjective.definition: Showing great care and perseverance.
adjective.example: she was assiduous in pointing out every feature

verb.definition: Make (an unpleasant feeling) less intense.
verb.example: the letter assuaged the fears of most members

adjective.definition: Causing the contraction of body tissues, typically of the skin.
adjective.example: an astringent skin lotion

adjective.definition: Sharp or severe in manner or style.
adjective.example: her astringent words had their effect

noun.definition: A substance that causes the contraction of body tissues, typically used to protect the skin and to reduce bleeding from minor abrasions.
The protection granted by a nation to someone who has left their native country as a political refugee.
noun.example: she applied for asylum and was granted refugee status

noun.definition: An institution offering shelter and support to people who are mentally ill.
noun.example: he'd been committed to an asylum

meaning: in biology; the reappearance of a characteristic in an organism after several generations of absence; individual or a part that exhibits atavism; return of a trait after a period of absence;

noun.definition: A tendency to revert to something ancient or ancestral.
noun.example: the more civilized a society seems to be, the more susceptible it is to its buried atavism

verb.definition: Reduce the force, effect, or value of.
verb.example: her intolerance was attenuated by an unexpected liberalism

verb.definition: Reduce in thickness; make thin.

adjective.definition: Reduced in force, effect, or physical thickness.
Showing a willingness to take surprisingly bold risks.
adjective.example: a series of audacious takeovers

adjective.definition: Showing an impudent lack of respect.
adjective.example: an audacious remark

adjective.definition: Severe or strict in manner, attitude, or appearance.
adjective.example: an austere man, with a rigidly puritanical outlook

adjective.definition: (of a country or region) having the freedom to govern itself or control its own affairs.
adjective.example: the federation included sixteen autonomous republics

adjective.definition: (in Kantian moral philosophy) acting in accordance with one's moral duty rather than one's desires.

noun.definition: Extreme greed for wealth or material gain.
noun.example: he was rich beyond the dreams of avarice

meaning: to affirm; declare to be true

verb.definition: State or assert to be the case.
verb.example: he averred that he was innocent of the allegations

noun.definition: A hobby or minor occupation.
noun.example: they are basically doctors, and negotiators by avocation

meaning: like an uncle; benevolent and tolerant;

adjective.definition: Relating to an uncle.
Relating to the relationship between men and their siblings' children.
Self-evident or unquestionable.
adjective.example: it is axiomatic that dividends have to be financed

meaning: pertaining to riotous or drunken festivity; pertaining to revelry

adjective.definition: Characterized by or given to drunken revelry; riotously drunken.
adjective.example: a bacchanalian orgy

adjective.definition: So lacking in originality as to be obvious and boring.
adjective.example: songs with banal, repeated words

noun.definition: The playful and friendly exchange of teasing remarks.
noun.example: there was much singing and good-natured banter

verb.definition: Talk or exchange remarks in a good-humored teasing way.
verb.example: the men bantered with the waitresses

noun.definition: A poet, traditionally one reciting epics and associated with a particular oral tradition.
A slice of bacon placed on meat or game before roasting.

verb.definition: Cover (meat or game) with slices of bacon.
verb.example: the venison was barded and marinated

adjective.definition: Dealing with sexual matters in a comical way; humorously indecent.

noun.definition: Humorously indecent talk or writing.

meaning: to sanctify; to bless; to ascribe a virtue to

verb.definition: (in the Roman Catholic Church) announce the beatification of.
verb.example: he beatified Juan Diego, an Indian believed to have had a vision of the Virgin Mary in 1531

meaning: to dress in a vulgar; showy manner;

verb.definition: Dress up or decorate gaudily.
verb.example: a uniform bedizened with resplendent medals

meaning: huge creature; anything very large and powerful

noun.definition: A huge or monstrous creature.

meaning: to contradict; misrepresent; give a false impression

verb.definition: (of an appearance) fail to give a true notion or impression of (something); disguise or contradict.
verb.example: his lively, alert manner belied his years

verb.definition: Fail to fulfill or justify (a claim or expectation); betray.
verb.example: the notebooks belie Darwin's later recollection

adjective.definition: (of a person) generous or doing good.

verb.definition: Divide into two branches or forks.
verb.example: just below Cairo the river bifurcates

adjective.definition: Forked; branched.
adjective.example: a bifurcate tree

noun.definition: A flattering or pleasing statement or action used to persuade someone gently to do something.
noun.example: the blandishments of the travel brochure

meaning: bored because of frequent indulgence; unconcerned

adjective.definition: Unimpressed or indifferent to something because one has experienced or seen it so often before.
adjective.example: she was becoming quite blasé about the dangers

meaning: to give a boost to; prop up; support

noun.definition: A long, thick pillow that is placed under other pillows for support.

verb.definition: Support or strengthen; prop up.
verb.example: the fall in interest rates is starting to bolster confidence

noun.definition: A heavy chisel used for cutting bricks.

adjective.definition: High-sounding but with little meaning; inflated.
adjective.example: bombastic rhetoric

adjective.definition: Rough and bad-mannered; coarse.
adjective.example: boorish behavior

adjective.definition: Relating to or affecting cattle.
adjective.example: bovine tuberculosis

noun.definition: An animal of the cattle group, which also includes buffaloes and bisons.

adjective.definition: Bold and without shame.
adjective.example: he went about his illegal business with a brazen assurance

adjective.definition: Made of brass.

verb.definition: Endure an embarrassing or difficult situation by behaving with apparent confidence and lack of shame.
synonyms: put a bold face on it

meaning: to mention for the first time

verb.definition: Raise (a sensitive or difficult subject) for discussion.
verb.example: he broached the subject he had been avoiding all evening

verb.definition: Pierce (a cask) to draw liquor.
(of a fish or sea mammal) rise through the water and break the surface.
verb.example: the salmon broach, then fall to slap the water

verb.definition: (of a ship with the wind on the quarter) veer and pitch forward because of bad steering or a sea hitting the stern, causing it to present a side to the wind and sea, lose steerage, and possibly suffer serious damage.
verb.example: we had broached badly, side on to the wind and sea

noun.definition: A sudden and hazardous veering or pitching of a ship.
